intro: Spyridium thymifolium, commonly known as the thyme-leaved spyridium, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic, glandular leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow, linear, and covered in fine hairs, resembling the appearance of thyme. Spyridium thymifolium is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
